titles: The courtiers health; or The merry boyes of the times he that loves sack, doth nothing lack, if he but loyal be, he that denyes Bacchus supplyes shows meere hypocrisie. To a new tune, Come boyes fill us a bumper, or My lodging is on the cold ground.
author: Taubman, Matthew, d. 1690?
publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby at the Golden Ball in West-Smithfield,
notes: Verse: "Come boyes fill us a bumper ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Attributed to Matthew Taubman. Cf. Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library and the British Library.
keywords: Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Poetry --  Early works to 1800.
